014package org.microbean.bean;
015
016import java.util.Collection;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Objects;
019
020import java.util.function.IntFunction;
021import java.util.function.Supplier;
022
023/**
024 * An abstract {@link Instantiator} implementation that is capable of performing dependency resolution.
025 *
026 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson/" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
027 *
028 * @see #instantiate()
029 */
030// Experimental, but it sure feels like it's on the right track.
031//
032// Subordinate to Producer<I> (and therefore Factory<I>).
033//
034// Creates something, performing constructor injection. Does absolutely nothing else at the moment. Will, certainly,
035// NEVER do constructor or business method interception.
036//
037// Not used by org.microbean.bean itself, but incredibly useful.
038//
039// TODO: this isn't really specific to instantiation; can be used for invoking any method, for example
040public abstract class AbstractInstantiator<R, I> implements Instantiator<I> {
041
042
043  /*
044   * Instance fields.
045   */
046
047
048  private final Supplier<I> s;
049
050
051  /*
052   * Constructors.
053   */
054
055
056  /**
057   * Creates a new {@link AbstractInstantiator} implementation (convenience constructor).
058   *
059   * @see #AbstractInstantiator(Object, IntFunction)
060   */
061  // For creating something that has no dependencies via a constructor (for example)
062  protected AbstractInstantiator() {
063    this(null);
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Creates a new {@link AbstractInstantiator} implementation (convenience constructor).
068   *
069   * @param df an {@link IntFunction} that accepts a zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or
070   * constructor parameter) and returns a (possibly {@code null}) resolved dependency suitable for that position; may be
071   * {@code null}
072   *
073   * @see #AbstractInstantiator(Supplier, IntFunction)
074   */
075  protected AbstractInstantiator(final IntFunction<?> df) {
076    this((Supplier<? extends R>)null, df);
077  }
078
079  /**
080   * Creates a new {@link AbstractInstantiator} implementation (convenience constructor).
081   *
082   * @param receiver a receiver whose instance method (or similar) will be used to instantiate the product; may be
083   * {@code null} if such a receiver is not needed
084   *
085   * @param df an {@link IntFunction} that accepts a zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or
086   * constructor parameter) and returns a (possibly {@code null}) resolved dependency suitable for that position; may be
087   * {@code null}
088   *
089   * @see #AbstractInstantiator(Supplier, IntFunction)
090   */
091  protected AbstractInstantiator(final R receiver, final IntFunction<?> df) {
092    super();
093    final IntFunction<?> f = df == null ? AbstractInstantiator::returnNull : df;
094    this.s = () -> this.instantiate(receiver, f);
095  }
096
097  /**
098   * Creates a new {@link AbstractInstantiator} implementation (preferred constructor).
099   *
100   * @param rs a {@link Supplier} of a receiver whose instance method (or similar) will be used to instantiate the
101   * product; may be {@code null} if such a receiver is not needed
102   *
103   * @param df an {@link IntFunction} that accepts a zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or
104   * constructor parameter) and returns a (possibly {@code null}) resolved dependency suitable for that position; may be
105   * {@code null}
106   */
107  protected AbstractInstantiator(final Supplier<? extends R> rs, final IntFunction<?> df) {
108    super();
109    final Supplier<? extends R> s = rs == null ? AbstractInstantiator::returnNull : rs;
110    final IntFunction<?> f = df == null ? AbstractInstantiator::returnNull : df;
111    this.s = () -> this.instantiate(s.get(), f);
112  }
113
114  /**
115   * Creates a new {@link AbstractInstantiator} implementation (convenience constructor).
116   *
117   * @param c a {@link Creation}; may be {@code null}
118   *
119   * @param bscs a {@link Collection} of {@link BeanSelectionCriteria} that will be used to resolve required
120   * dependencies; may be {@code null} if there are no dependencies required for the instantiation mechanism
121   *
122   * @param rs a {@link ReferenceSelector}; may be {@code null} if {@code beanClassSelectionCriteria} is {@code null}
123   * and there are no dependencies to resolve
124   *
125   * @exception NullPointerException in certain cases if {@code rs} is {@code null}
126   *
127   * @see #AbstractInstantiator(BeanSelectionCriteria, Creation, IntFunction, PositionalCreationBiFunction,
128   * ReferenceSelector)
129   */
130  protected AbstractInstantiator(final Creation<?> c,
131                                 final Collection<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> bscs,
132                                 final ReferenceSelector rs) {
133    this(null, c, bscf(bscs, null), null, rs);
134  }
135
136  /**
137   * Creates a new {@link AbstractInstantiator} implementation (convenience constructor).
138   *
139   * @param c a {@link Creation}; may be {@code null}
140   *
141   * @param bscs a {@link Collection} of {@link BeanSelectionCriteria} that will be used to resolve required
142   * dependencies; may be {@code null} if there are no dependencies required for the instantiation mechanism
143   *
144   * @param pcbf a {@link PositionalCreationBiFunction} that supplies a {@link Creation} given an initial {@link
145   * Creation} and a zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or constructor parameter); may be {@code
146   * null}; the first argument supplied to this {@link PositionalCreationBiFunction} will be {@code c}
147   *
148   * @param rs a {@link ReferenceSelector}; may be {@code null} if {@code beanClassSelectionCriteria} is {@code null}
149   * and there are no dependencies to resolve
150   *
151   * @exception NullPointerException in certain cases if {@code rs} is {@code null}
152   *
153   * @see #AbstractInstantiator(BeanSelectionCriteria, Creation, IntFunction, PositionalCreationBiFunction,
154   * ReferenceSelector)
155   */
156  protected AbstractInstantiator(final Creation<?> c,
157                                 final Collection<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> bscs,
158                                 final PositionalCreationBiFunction pcbf,
159                                 final ReferenceSelector rs) {
160    this(null, c, bscf(bscs, null), pcbf, rs);
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Creates a new {@link AbstractInstantiator} implementation (convenience constructor).
165   *
166   * @param beanClassSelectionCriteria a {@link BeanSelectionCriteria} that can select the receiver whose instance method
167   * (or similar) will be used to instantiate the product; may be {@code null} if such a receiver is not needed
168   *
169   * @param c a {@link Creation}; may be {@code null}
170   *
171   * @param bscs a {@link Collection} of {@link BeanSelectionCriteria} that will be used to resolve required
172   * dependencies; may be {@code null} if there are no dependencies required for the instantiation mechanism
173   *
174   * @param zeroBasedPositions an even-length array of {@code int}s whose even-indexed elements are "positions" (such as
175   * of parameters of a method or constructor) and whose odd-indexed elements are corresponding indices into a {@link
176   * List} formed from the supplied {@code bscs} {@link Collection}; the array thus serves as a kind of map; may be
177   * {@code null}
178   *
179   * @param pcbf a {@link PositionalCreationBiFunction} that supplies a {@link Creation} given an initial {@link
180   * Creation} and a zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or constructor parameter); may be {@code
181   * null}; the first argument supplied to this {@link PositionalCreationBiFunction} will be {@code c}
182   *
183   * @param rs a {@link ReferenceSelector}; may be {@code null} if {@code beanClassSelectionCriteria} is {@code null}
184   * and there are no dependencies to resolve
185   *
186   * @exception NullPointerException in certain cases if {@code rs} is {@code null}
187   *
188   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code zeroBasedPositions} is not empty and {@code bscs} is empty, or if
189   * {@code zeroBasedPositions} is empty and {@code bscs} is not empty, or if the length of the {@code int} array is
190   * greater than the size of the {@code bscs} {@link Collection}
191   *
192   * @exception IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code zeroBasedPositions} contains an {@code int} that is less than {@code
193   * 0}
194   *
195   * @see #AbstractInstantiator(BeanSelectionCriteria, Creation, IntFunction, PositionalCreationBiFunction,
196   * ReferenceSelector)
197   */
198  protected AbstractInstantiator(final BeanSelectionCriteria beanClassSelectionCriteria,
199                                 final Creation<?> c,
200                                 final Collection<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> bscs,
201                                 final int[] zeroBasedPositions,
202                                 final PositionalCreationBiFunction pcbf,
203                                 final ReferenceSelector rs) {
204    this(beanClassSelectionCriteria,
205         c,
206         bscf(bscs, zeroBasedPositions),
207         pcbf,
208         rs);
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Creates a new {@link AbstractInstantiator} implementation (preferred constructor).
213   *
214   * @param beanClassSelectionCriteria a {@link BeanSelectionCriteria} that can select the receiver whose instance
215   * method (or similar) will be used to instantiate the product; may be {@code null} if such a receiver is not needed
216   *
217   * @param c a {@link Creation}; may be {@code null}
218   *
219   * @param f an {@link IntFunction} that accepts a zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or
220   * constructor parameter) and returns a (possibly {@code null} {@link BeanSelectionCriteria} corresponding to that
221   * position; may be {@code null} if there are no dependencies to be resolved
222   *
223   * @param pcbf a {@link PositionalCreationBiFunction} that supplies a {@link Creation} given an initial {@link
224   * Creation} and a zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or constructor parameter); may be {@code
225   * null}; the first argument supplied to this {@link PositionalCreationBiFunction} will be {@code c}
226   *
227   * @param rs a {@link ReferenceSelector}; may be {@code null} if {@code beanClassSelectionCriteria} is {@code null}
228   * and there are no dependencies to resolve
229   *
230   * @exception NullPointerException in certain cases if {@code rs} is {@code null}
231   */
232  protected AbstractInstantiator(final BeanSelectionCriteria beanClassSelectionCriteria, // nullable
233                                 final Creation<?> c,
234                                 final IntFunction<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> f,
235                                 final PositionalCreationBiFunction pcbf,
236                                 final ReferenceSelector rs) {
237    super();
238    final PositionalCreationBiFunction cf = pcbf == null ? AbstractInstantiator::ignorePosition : pcbf;
239    if (beanClassSelectionCriteria == null) {
240      if (f == null) {
241        this.s = () -> this.instantiate(null, AbstractInstantiator::returnNull);
242      } else {
243        Objects.requireNonNull(rs, "rs");
244        this.s = () -> this.instantiate(null, p -> rs.reference(f.apply(p), cf.apply(c, p)));
245      }
246    } else {
247      Objects.requireNonNull(rs, "rs");
248      if (f == null) {
249        this.s = () -> this.instantiate(rs.reference(beanClassSelectionCriteria, Creation.cast(c)),
250                                        AbstractInstantiator::returnNull);
251      } else {
252        this.s = () -> this.instantiate(rs.reference(beanClassSelectionCriteria, Creation.cast(c)),
253                                        p -> rs.reference(f.apply(p), cf.apply(c, p)));
254      }
255    }
256  }
257
258
259  /*
260   * Instance methods.
261   */
262
263
264  /**
265   * Instantiates the product and returns it.
266   *
267   * @return the result of instantiation; never {@code null}
268   *
269   * @see #instantiate(Object, IntFunction)
270   */
271  @Override // Instantiator<I>
272  public final I instantiate() {
273    return this.s.get();
274  }
275
276  /**
277   * Instantiates the product and returns it, possibly using the supplied <em>receiver</em> and dependency resolver
278   * function.
279   *
280   * <p>Implementations of this method must not return {@code null}.</p>
281   *
282   * <p>This method is invoked by the {@link #instantiate()} method. Implementations of this method must not call {@link
283   * #instantiate()} or an infinite loop may result.</p>
284   *
285   * @param r a receiver on which an instance method may be invoked, if that is the means of instantiation; may be
286   * {@code null} if no such receiver is required or could be located
287   *
288   * @param f an {@link IntFunction} that, given a zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or constructor
289   * parameter), returns a resolved depdencency suitable for that location, or {@code null}; must not be {@code null}
290   *
291   * @return the product; never {@code null}
292   *
293   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code f} is {@code null}
294   *
295   * @exception IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code f} is supplied with a negative {@code int} as its second argument
296   */
297  // r: a receiver on which an instance method may be invoked
298  // f: an IntFunction taking a position (such as of a parameter) and returning a dependency (which may be null)
299  protected abstract I instantiate(final R r, final IntFunction<?> f);
300
301
302  /*
303   * Static methods.
304   */
305
306
307  private static <T> T returnNull() {
308    return null;
309  }
310
311  private static <T> T returnNull(final int ignored) {
312    return null;
313  }
314
315  private static <T> T ignorePosition(final T returnValue, final int ignored) {
316    return returnValue;
317  }
318
319  private static IntFunction<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> bscf(final Collection<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> bscs,
320                                                                   final int[] zeroBasedPositions) {
321    final List<BeanSelectionCriteria> finalBscs = bscs == null || bscs.isEmpty() ? List.of() : List.copyOf(bscs);
322    if (zeroBasedPositions == null) {
323      return finalBscs::get;
324    }
325    final int[] ps = zeroBasedPositions.clone();
326    if (ps.length <= 0) {
327      if (!finalBscs.isEmpty()) {
328        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
329      }
330      return AbstractInstantiator::returnNull;
331    } else if (ps.length % 2 != 0) {
332      throw new IllegalArgumentException();
333    } else {
334      for (int i = 0; i < ps.length; i++) {
335        if (ps[i] < 0) {
336          throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("ps[" + i + "]: " + ps[i]);
337        }
338      }
339      return p -> {
340        for (int i = 0; i < ps.length; i++) {
341          if (ps[i++] == p) {
342            return finalBscs.get(ps[i]);
343          }
344        }
345        return null;
346      };
347    }
348  }
349
350
351  /*
352   * Inner and nested classes.
353   */
354
355
356  /**
357   * A {@linkplain FunctionalInterface functional interface} that returns a suitable {@link Creation} given a zero-based
358   * <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or constructor parameter).
359   *
360   * @see #apply(Creation, int)
361   */
362  @FunctionalInterface
363  public static interface PositionalCreationBiFunction {
364
365    /**
366     * Returns a (possibly {@code null}) {@link Creation}, which might be the supplied {@link Creation}, suitable for
367     * the supplied, zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or constructor parameter).
368     *
369     * <p>Implementations of this method may return {@code null}.</p>
370     *
371     * @param c a {@link Creation}; may be {@code null}
372     *
373     * @param p a zero-based <em>position</em> (such as that of a method or constructor parameter); must not be negative
374     *
375     * @exception IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code p} is negative
376     */
377    public Creation<?> apply(final Creation<?> c, final int p);
378
379  }
380
381}
